articles.title: Can Michael Thurmond be Georgia Democrats' fixer?
articles.description: Former DeKalb CEO Michael Thurmond hopes his brand of pragmatism and bipartisanship will help Democrats win the governor's race for the first time in 28 years, positioning himself as a proven 'fixer' who has successfully turned around troubled institutions.

articles.title: All eyes are on Trump after no Republican emerges as the frontrunner in Georgia's U.S. Senate race
articles.description: Republicans Mike Collins, Buddy Carter, and Derek Dooley are locked in a three-way race to challenge Jon Ossoff, with similar fundraising totals leaving the GOP primary wide open. Ossoff continues raising huge sums, having collected $12 million in Q3 alone.
articles.relevance: Analysis of competitive Republican primary for Ossoff's seat

articles.title: Sunday Conversation: Georgia Democratic Party Chairman Charlie Bailey talks partisan politics
articles.description: Georgia Democratic Party Chairman Charlie Bailey discusses the party's top priority of protecting Jon Ossoff's U.S. Senate seat and electing Democrats locally and statewide moving into the 2026 election year.
articles.relevance: State party chair outlines 2026 Democratic strategy
